subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material: Holotype of D. orientale
♂ : Holotype // Anei Kloof/(Sumatra’s West/ Kust ) 500 M. 1925/Leg. E. Jacobson.//
Dolichocolon

orientale TT
/

♂ /Det CHTT //Type//
Dolichocolon
/
orientale
/ Townsend 1927 / ZMAN type DIPT . 2188.1 [ ZMAN ].
Notes: Specimen in very bad condition: head collapsed and most of the legs missing or greatly damaged; moreover, the body is mainly covered with hyphae.

Holotype of D. klapperichi
♂ : [ China ] Kwangtseh– Fukien/J. Klapperich 0/9.10 1937//
Dolichocolon klapperichi Mesn
/L.P. Mesnil det., 1967//Type// Holotype ♂ /of
Dolichocolon
/
klapperichi
/Mesnil/Examined 1970/ R .W. Crosskey [ CNC ] [specimen in good condition].

, leg. S. Lin [written in Chinese ] [ BLKU ]
.

1400 m
,
21.–22.xi.1973
, leg. R
.
Kano et al . [labelled as
Dolichocolon klapperichi
] [ BLKU ]
.

.

;

.

;

.

.

, leg. H. Kurahashi [ BLKU ]
;

1231 m
, Fang ,
27.ix.1975
[determined as
Dolichocolon klapperichi Mesn
by H. Shima ] [ BLKU ]
.

Coloration and pruinescence: Head mainly black. Thickened portion of third aristomere brownishyellow. Palpus mainly yellow. Thorax mainly black; posterior 1/3–4/5 of scutellum reddish-yellow; scutum covered with grey pruinescence, presutural area with four dark vittae. Abdomen black, more or less reddish laterally on tergites 3 and 4; tergite 3 with a transverse band of whitish-grey pruinescence on anterior 1/3–3/4, tergite 4 pruinose on anterior 2/3–1/1, tergite 5 on anterior 1/2–1/1 (the remaining posterior surface is covered with brown-bronze pruinescence) ( Fig. 13B–D ).

Head ( Fig. 13A ):
Compound eye usually covered with scattered ommatrichia, about as long as combined diameter of one to four facets (visible under> 60 ¥ magnification on black background); more rarely compound eye bare. Second aristomere about 4.0–7.5 times as long as wide. Thickened part of third aristomere about 2.0–2.5 times as long as second aristomere. Postpedicel about seven to nine times as long as pedicel. Vertex at its narrowest point 0.9–1.1 times as wide as compound eye in dorsal view. Gena in profile about 0.20–0.25 times as high as compound eye. Lateral vertical seta not differentiated from postocular setae. Postocular setae fine, relatively long, slightly bent anteriorly. Prementum about 1.0–1.5 times as long as wide.

Abdomen ( Fig. 13B–D ):
Syntergite 1 + 2 with short and robust median marginal setae. Tergite 3 with one pair of median marginal setae about 0.8–0.9 times as long as corresponding tergite. Tergite 4 with a row of nine to 12 marginal setae. Tergite 5 with a row of marginal and discal setae.
Distribution: Australasian: Papua New Guinea . Oriental : China ( Fujian , Yunnan ), Indonesia ( Sumatra ), Thailand . Palaearctic : Japan (Honshu) (new record).

Notes: All records from China mentioned by
Chao et al . (1998)
and
O’Hara et al . (2009)
as
D. klapperichi Mesnil
( Guangdong , Hainan , Guangxi , Gansu , Jilin , Ningxia , Sichuan , Shanxi , Shaanxi ) need confirmation. The male terminalia figured by
Chao et al . (1998: 1890
, 626L1, 3626Mp) do not in our opinion belong to either
D. orientale
or to any described species except possibly
D. cantrelli
sp. nov.
